30#include <sys/cdefs.h>
31__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_ddi.c,v 1.10 2019/02/19 00:30:16 christos Exp $");
32
33#include <linux/math64.h>
34
35#include "i915_drv.h"
36#include "intel_drv.h"
37
38struct ddi_buf_trans {
39 u32 trans1; /* balance leg enable, de-emph level */
40 u32 trans2; /* vref sel, vswing */
41 u8 i_boost; /* SKL: I_boost; valid: 0x0, 0x1, 0x3, 0x7 */
42};
43
44/* HDMI/DVI modes ignore everything but the last 2 items. So we share
45 * them for both DP and FDI transports, allowing those ports to
46 * automatically adapt to HDMI connections as well
47 */
48static const struct ddi_buf_trans hsw_ddi_translations_dp[] = {
49 { 0x00FFFFFF, 0x0006000E, 0x0 },
50 { 0x00D75FFF, 0x0005000A, 0x0 },
51 { 0x00C30FFF, 0x00040006, 0x0 },
52 { 0x80AAAFFF, 0x000B0000, 0x0 },
53 { 0x00FFFFFF, 0x0005000A, 0x0 },
54 { 0x00D75FFF, 0x000C0004, 0x0 },
55 { 0x80C30FFF, 0x000B0000, 0x0 },
56 { 0x00FFFFFF, 0x00040006, 0x0 },
57 { 0x80D75FFF, 0x000B0000, 0x0 },
58};
59
60static const struct ddi_buf_trans hsw_ddi_translations_fdi[] = {
61 { 0x00FFFFFF, 0x0007000E, 0x0 },
62 { 0x00D75FFF, 0x000F000A, 0x0 },
63 { 0x00C30FFF, 0x00060006, 0x0 },
64 { 0x00AAAFFF, 0x001E0000, 0x0 },
65 { 0x00FFFFFF, 0x000F000A, 0x0 },
66 { 0x00D75FFF, 0x00160004, 0x0 },
67 { 0x00C30FFF, 0x001E0000, 0x0 },
68 { 0x00FFFFFF, 0x00060006, 0x0 },
69 { 0x00D75FFF, 0x001E0000, 0x0 },
70};

85 { 0x80FFFFFF, 0x00030002, 0x0 },/* 11: 1000 1000 0 */
86};

257
258struct bxt_ddi_buf_trans {
259 u32 margin; /* swing value */
260 u32 scale; /* scale value */
261 u32 enable; /* scale enable */
262 u32 deemphasis;
263 bool default_index; /* true if the entry represents default value */
264};
265
266static const struct bxt_ddi_buf_trans bxt_ddi_translations_dp[] = {
267 /* Idx NT mV diff db */
268 { 52, 0x9A, 0, 128, true }, /* 0: 400 0 */
269 { 78, 0x9A, 0, 85, false }, /* 1: 400 3.5 */
270 { 104, 0x9A, 0, 64, false }, /* 2: 400 6 */
271 { 154, 0x9A, 0, 43, false }, /* 3: 400 9.5 */
272 { 77, 0x9A, 0, 128, false }, /* 4: 600 0 */
273 { 116, 0x9A, 0, 85, false }, /* 5: 600 3.5 */
274 { 154, 0x9A, 0, 64, false }, /* 6: 600 6 */
275 { 102, 0x9A, 0, 128, false }, /* 7: 800 0 */
276 { 154, 0x9A, 0, 85, false }, /* 8: 800 3.5 */
277 { 154, 0x9A, 1, 128, false }, /* 9: 1200 0 */

294/* BSpec has 2 recommended values - entries 0 and 8.
295 * Using the entry with higher vswing.
296 */
297static const struct bxt_ddi_buf_trans bxt_ddi_translations_hdmi[] = {
298 /* Idx NT mV diff db */

300 { 52, 0x9A, 0, 85, false }, /* 1: 400 3.5 */

302 { 42, 0x9A, 0, 43, false }, /* 3: 400 9.5 */
303 { 77, 0x9A, 0, 128, false }, /* 4: 600 0 */
304 { 77, 0x9A, 0, 85, false }, /* 5: 600 3.5 */
305 { 77, 0x9A, 0, 64, false }, /* 6: 600 6 */
306 { 102, 0x9A, 0, 128, false }, /* 7: 800 0 */
307 { 102, 0x9A, 0, 85, false }, /* 8: 800 3.5 */
308 { 154, 0x9A, 1, 128, true }, /* 9: 1200 0 */
309};
310
311static void bxt_ddi_vswing_sequence(struct drm_device *dev, u32 level,
312 enum port port, int type);
313
314static void ddi_get_encoder_port(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder,
315 struct intel_digital_port **dig_port,
316 enum port *port)
317{
318 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_encoder->base;
319
320 switch (intel_encoder->type) {
321 case INTEL_OUTPUT_DP_MST:
322 *dig_port = enc_to_mst(encoder)->primary;
323 *port = (*dig_port)->port;
324 break;
325 case INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT:
326 case INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP:
327 case INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI:
328 case INTEL_OUTPUT_UNKNOWN:
329 *dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
330 *port = (*dig_port)->port;
331 break;
332 case INTEL_OUTPUT_ANALOG:
333 *dig_port = NULL;
334 *port = PORT_E;
335 break;
336 default:
337 WARN(1, "Invalid DDI encoder type %d\n", intel_encoder->type);
338 break;
339 }
340}
341
342enum port intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
343{
344 struct intel_digital_port *dig_port;
345 enum port port;
346
347 ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder, &dig_port, &port);
348
349 return port;
350}
351
352static bool
353intel_dig_port_supports_hdmi(const struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port)
354{
355 return intel_dig_port->hdmi.hdmi_reg;
356}
357
358static const struct ddi_buf_trans *skl_get_buf_trans_dp(struct drm_device *dev,
359 int *n_entries)
360{
361 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations;
362
363 if (IS_SKL_ULX(dev) || IS_KBL_ULX(dev)) {
364 ddi_translations = skl_y_ddi_translations_dp;
365 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_y_ddi_translations_dp);
366 } else if (IS_SKL_ULT(dev) || IS_KBL_ULT(dev)) {
367 ddi_translations = skl_u_ddi_translations_dp;
368 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_u_ddi_translations_dp);
369 } else {
370 ddi_translations = skl_ddi_translations_dp;
371 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_ddi_translations_dp);
372 }
373
374 return ddi_translations;
375}
376
377static const struct ddi_buf_trans *skl_get_buf_trans_edp(struct drm_device *dev,
378 int *n_entries)
379{
380 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
381 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations;
382
383 if (IS_SKL_ULX(dev) || IS_KBL_ULX(dev)) {
384 if (dev_priv->edp_low_vswing) {
385 ddi_translations = skl_y_ddi_translations_edp;
386 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_y_ddi_translations_edp);
387 } else {
388 ddi_translations = skl_y_ddi_translations_dp;
389 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_y_ddi_translations_dp);
390 }
391 } else if (IS_SKL_ULT(dev) || IS_KBL_ULT(dev)) {
392 if (dev_priv->edp_low_vswing) {
393 ddi_translations = skl_u_ddi_translations_edp;
394 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_u_ddi_translations_edp);
395 } else {
396 ddi_translations = skl_u_ddi_translations_dp;
397 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_u_ddi_translations_dp);
398 }
399 } else {
400 if (dev_priv->edp_low_vswing) {
401 ddi_translations = skl_ddi_translations_edp;
402 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_ddi_translations_edp);
403 } else {
404 ddi_translations = skl_ddi_translations_dp;
405 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_ddi_translations_dp);
406 }
407 }
408
409 return ddi_translations;
410}
411
412static const struct ddi_buf_trans *
413skl_get_buf_trans_hdmi(struct drm_device *dev,
414 int *n_entries)
415{
416 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations;
417
418 if (IS_SKL_ULX(dev) || IS_KBL_ULX(dev)) {
419 ddi_translations = skl_y_ddi_translations_hdmi;
420 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_y_ddi_translations_hdmi);
421 } else {
422 ddi_translations = skl_ddi_translations_hdmi;
423 *n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(skl_ddi_translations_hdmi);
424 }
425
426 return ddi_translations;
427}
428
429/*
430 * Starting with Haswell, DDI port buffers must be programmed with correct
431 * values in advance. The buffer values are different for FDI and DP modes,
432 * but the HDMI/DVI fields are shared among those. So we program the DDI
433 * in either FDI or DP modes only, as HDMI connections will work with both
434 * of those
435 */
436static void intel_prepare_ddi_buffers(struct drm_device *dev, enum port port,
437 bool supports_hdmi)
438{
439 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
440 u32 iboost_bit = 0;
441 int i, n_hdmi_entries, n_dp_entries, n_edp_entries, hdmi_default_entry,
442 size;
443 int hdmi_level = dev_priv->vbt.ddi_port_info[port].hdmi_level_shift;
444 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations_fdi;
445 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations_dp;
446 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations_edp;
447 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations_hdmi;
448 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations;
449
450 if (IS_BROXTON(dev)) {
451 if (!supports_hdmi)
452 return;
453
454 /* Vswing programming for HDMI */
455 bxt_ddi_vswing_sequence(dev, hdmi_level, port,
456 INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI);
457 return;
458 } else if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev)) {
459 ddi_translations_fdi = NULL;
460 ddi_translations_dp =
461 skl_get_buf_trans_dp(dev, &n_dp_entries);
462 ddi_translations_edp =
463 skl_get_buf_trans_edp(dev, &n_edp_entries);
464 ddi_translations_hdmi =
465 skl_get_buf_trans_hdmi(dev, &n_hdmi_entries);
466 hdmi_default_entry = 8;
467 /* If we're boosting the current, set bit 31 of trans1 */
468 if (dev_priv->vbt.ddi_port_info[port].hdmi_boost_level ||
469 dev_priv->vbt.ddi_port_info[port].dp_boost_level)
470 iboost_bit = 1<<31;
471 } else if (IS_BROADWELL(dev)) {
472 ddi_translations_fdi = bdw_ddi_translations_fdi;
473 ddi_translations_dp = bdw_ddi_translations_dp;
474
475 if (dev_priv->edp_low_vswing) {
476 ddi_translations_edp = bdw_ddi_translations_edp;
477 n_edp_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bdw_ddi_translations_edp);
478 } else {
479 ddi_translations_edp = bdw_ddi_translations_dp;
480 n_edp_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bdw_ddi_translations_dp);
481 }
482
483 ddi_translations_hdmi = bdw_ddi_translations_hdmi;
484
485 n_dp_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bdw_ddi_translations_dp);
486 n_hdmi_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bdw_ddi_translations_hdmi);
487 hdmi_default_entry = 7;
488 } else if (IS_HASWELL(dev)) {
489 ddi_translations_fdi = hsw_ddi_translations_fdi;
490 ddi_translations_dp = hsw_ddi_translations_dp;
491 ddi_translations_edp = hsw_ddi_translations_dp;
492 ddi_translations_hdmi = hsw_ddi_translations_hdmi;
493 n_dp_entries = n_edp_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(hsw_ddi_translations_dp);
494 n_hdmi_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(hsw_ddi_translations_hdmi);
495 hdmi_default_entry = 6;
496 } else {
497 WARN(1, "ddi translation table missing\n");
498 ddi_translations_edp = bdw_ddi_translations_dp;
499 ddi_translations_fdi = bdw_ddi_translations_fdi;
500 ddi_translations_dp = bdw_ddi_translations_dp;
501 ddi_translations_hdmi = bdw_ddi_translations_hdmi;
502 n_edp_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bdw_ddi_translations_edp);
503 n_dp_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bdw_ddi_translations_dp);
504 n_hdmi_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bdw_ddi_translations_hdmi);
505 hdmi_default_entry = 7;
506 }
507
508 switch (port) {
509 case PORT_A:
510 ddi_translations = ddi_translations_edp;
511 size = n_edp_entries;
512 break;
513 case PORT_B:
514 case PORT_C:
515 ddi_translations = ddi_translations_dp;
516 size = n_dp_entries;
517 break;
518 case PORT_D:
519 if (intel_dp_is_edp(dev, PORT_D)) {
520 ddi_translations = ddi_translations_edp;
521 size = n_edp_entries;
522 } else {
523 ddi_translations = ddi_translations_dp;
524 size = n_dp_entries;
525 }
526 break;
527 case PORT_E:
528 if (ddi_translations_fdi)
529 ddi_translations = ddi_translations_fdi;
530 else
531 ddi_translations = ddi_translations_dp;
532 size = n_dp_entries;
533 break;
534 default:
535 BUG();
536 }
537
538 for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
539 I915_WRITE(DDI_BUF_TRANS_LO(port, i),
540 ddi_translations[i].trans1 | iboost_bit);
541 I915_WRITE(DDI_BUF_TRANS_HI(port, i),
542 ddi_translations[i].trans2);
543 }
544
545 if (!supports_hdmi)
546 return;
547
548 /* Choose a good default if VBT is badly populated */
549 if (hdmi_level == HDMI_LEVEL_SHIFT_UNKNOWN ||
550 hdmi_level >= n_hdmi_entries)
551 hdmi_level = hdmi_default_entry;
552
553 /* Entry 9 is for HDMI: */
554 I915_WRITE(DDI_BUF_TRANS_LO(port, i),
555 ddi_translations_hdmi[hdmi_level].trans1 | iboost_bit);
556 I915_WRITE(DDI_BUF_TRANS_HI(port, i),
557 ddi_translations_hdmi[hdmi_level].trans2);
558}
559
560/* Program DDI buffers translations for DP. By default, program ports A-D in DP
561 * mode and port E for FDI.
562 */
563void intel_prepare_ddi(struct drm_device *dev)
564{
565 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder;
566 bool visited[I915_MAX_PORTS] = { 0, };
567
568 if (!HAS_DDI(dev))
569 return;
570
571 for_each_intel_encoder(dev, intel_encoder) {
572 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port;
573 enum port port;
574 bool supports_hdmi;
575
576 if (intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DSI)
577 continue;
578
579 ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder, &intel_dig_port, &port);
580 if (visited[port])
581 continue;
582
583 supports_hdmi = intel_dig_port &&
584 intel_dig_port_supports_hdmi(intel_dig_port);
585
586 intel_prepare_ddi_buffers(dev, port, supports_hdmi);
587 visited[port] = true;
588 }
589}
590
591static void intel_wait_ddi_buf_idle(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
592 enum port port)
593{
594 uint32_t reg = DDI_BUF_CTL(port);
595 int i;
596
597 for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
598 udelay(1);
599 if (I915_READ(reg) & DDI_BUF_IS_IDLE)
600 return;
601 }
602 DRM_ERROR("Timeout waiting for DDI BUF %c idle bit\n", port_name(port));
603}
604
605/* Starting with Haswell, different DDI ports can work in FDI mode for
606 * connection to the PCH-located connectors. For this, it is necessary to train
607 * both the DDI port and PCH receiver for the desired DDI buffer settings.
608 *
609 * The recommended port to work in FDI mode is DDI E, which we use here. Also,
610 * please note that when FDI mode is active on DDI E, it shares 2 lines with
611 * DDI A (which is used for eDP)
612 */
613
614void hsw_fdi_link_train(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
615{
616 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
617 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
618 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
619 u32 temp, i, rx_ctl_val;
620
621 /* Set the FDI_RX_MISC pwrdn lanes and the 2 workarounds listed at the
622 * mode set "sequence for CRT port" document:
623 * - TP1 to TP2 time with the default value
624 * - FDI delay to 90h
625 *
626 * WaFDIAutoLinkSetTimingOverrride:hsw
627 */
628 I915_WRITE(FDI_RX_MISC(PIPE_A), FDI_RX_PWRDN_LANE1_VAL(2) |
629 FDI_RX_PWRDN_LANE0_VAL(2) |
630 FDI_RX_TP1_TO_TP2_48 | FDI_RX_FDI_DELAY_90);
631
632 /* Enable the PCH Receiver FDI PLL */
633 rx_ctl_val = dev_priv->fdi_rx_config | FDI_RX_ENHANCE_FRAME_ENABLE |
634 FDI_RX_PLL_ENABLE |
635 FDI_DP_PORT_WIDTH(intel_crtc->config->fdi_lanes);
636 I915_WRITE(FDI_RX_CTL(PIPE_A), rx_ctl_val);
637 POSTING_READ(FDI_RX_CTL(PIPE_A));
638 udelay(220);
639
640 /* Switch from Rawclk to PCDclk */
641 rx_ctl_val |= FDI_PCDCLK;
642 I915_WRITE(FDI_RX_CTL(PIPE_A), rx_ctl_val);
643
644 /* Configure Port Clock Select */
645 I915_WRITE(PORT_CLK_SEL(PORT_E), intel_crtc->config->ddi_pll_sel);
646 WARN_ON(intel_crtc->config->ddi_pll_sel != PORT_CLK_SEL_SPLL);
647
648 /* Start the training iterating through available voltages and emphasis,
649 * testing each value twice. */
650 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(hsw_ddi_translations_fdi) * 2; i++) {
651 /* Configure DP_TP_CTL with auto-training */
652 I915_WRITE(DP_TP_CTL(PORT_E),
653 DP_TP_CTL_FDI_AUTOTRAIN |
654 DP_TP_CTL_ENHANCED_FRAME_ENABLE |
655 DP_TP_CTL_LINK_TRAIN_PAT1 |
656 DP_TP_CTL_ENABLE);
657
658 /* Configure and enable DDI_BUF_CTL for DDI E with next voltage.
659 * DDI E does not support port reversal, the functionality is
660 * achieved on the PCH side in FDI_RX_CTL, so no need to set the
661 * port reversal bit */
662 I915_WRITE(DDI_BUF_CTL(PORT_E),
663 DDI_BUF_CTL_ENABLE |
664 ((intel_crtc->config->fdi_lanes - 1) << 1) |
665 DDI_BUF_TRANS_SELECT(i / 2));
666 POSTING_READ(DDI_BUF_CTL(PORT_E));
667
668 udelay(600);
669
670 /* Program PCH FDI Receiver TU */
671 I915_WRITE(FDI_RX_TUSIZE1(PIPE_A), TU_SIZE(64));
672
673 /* Enable PCH FDI Receiver with auto-training */
674 rx_ctl_val |= FDI_RX_ENABLE | FDI_LINK_TRAIN_AUTO;
675 I915_WRITE(FDI_RX_CTL(PIPE_A), rx_ctl_val);
676 POSTING_READ(FDI_RX_CTL(PIPE_A));
677
678 /* Wait for FDI receiver lane calibration */
679 udelay(30);
680
681 /* Unset FDI_RX_MISC pwrdn lanes */
682 temp = I915_READ(FDI_RX_MISC(PIPE_A));
683 temp &= ~(FDI_RX_PWRDN_LANE1_MASK | FDI_RX_PWRDN_LANE0_MASK);
684 I915_WRITE(FDI_RX_MISC(PIPE_A), temp);
685 POSTING_READ(FDI_RX_MISC(PIPE_A));
686
687 /* Wait for FDI auto training time */
688 udelay(5);
689
690 temp = I915_READ(DP_TP_STATUS(PORT_E));
691 if (temp & DP_TP_STATUS_AUTOTRAIN_DONE) {
692 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("FDI link training done on step %d\n", i);
693
694 /* Enable normal pixel sending for FDI */
695 I915_WRITE(DP_TP_CTL(PORT_E),
696 DP_TP_CTL_FDI_AUTOTRAIN |
697 DP_TP_CTL_LINK_TRAIN_NORMAL |
698 DP_TP_CTL_ENHANCED_FRAME_ENABLE |
699 DP_TP_CTL_ENABLE);
700
701 return;
702 }
703
704 temp = I915_READ(DDI_BUF_CTL(PORT_E));
705 temp &= ~DDI_BUF_CTL_ENABLE;
706 I915_WRITE(DDI_BUF_CTL(PORT_E), temp);
707 POSTING_READ(DDI_BUF_CTL(PORT_E));
708
709 /* Disable DP_TP_CTL and FDI_RX_CTL and retry */
710 temp = I915_READ(DP_TP_CTL(PORT_E));
711 temp &= ~(DP_TP_CTL_ENABLE | DP_TP_CTL_LINK_TRAIN_MASK);
712 temp |= DP_TP_CTL_LINK_TRAIN_PAT1;
713 I915_WRITE(DP_TP_CTL(PORT_E), temp);
714 POSTING_READ(DP_TP_CTL(PORT_E));
715
716 intel_wait_ddi_buf_idle(dev_priv, PORT_E);
717
718 rx_ctl_val &= ~FDI_RX_ENABLE;
719 I915_WRITE(FDI_RX_CTL(PIPE_A), rx_ctl_val);
720 POSTING_READ(FDI_RX_CTL(PIPE_A));
721
722 /* Reset FDI_RX_MISC pwrdn lanes */
723 temp = I915_READ(FDI_RX_MISC(PIPE_A));
724 temp &= ~(FDI_RX_PWRDN_LANE1_MASK | FDI_RX_PWRDN_LANE0_MASK);
725 temp |= FDI_RX_PWRDN_LANE1_VAL(2) | FDI_RX_PWRDN_LANE0_VAL(2);
726 I915_WRITE(FDI_RX_MISC(PIPE_A), temp);
727 POSTING_READ(FDI_RX_MISC(PIPE_A));
728 }
729
730 DRM_ERROR("FDI link training failed!\n");
731}
732
733void intel_ddi_init_dp_buf_reg(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
734{
735 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = enc_to_intel_dp(&encoder->base);
736 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port =
737 enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
738
739 intel_dp->DP = intel_dig_port->saved_port_bits |
740 DDI_BUF_CTL_ENABLE | DDI_BUF_TRANS_SELECT(0);
741 intel_dp->DP |= DDI_PORT_WIDTH(intel_dp->lane_count);
742}
743
744static struct intel_encoder *
745intel_ddi_get_crtc_encoder(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
746{
747 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
748 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
749 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder, *ret = NULL;
750 int num_encoders = 0;
751
752 for_each_encoder_on_crtc(dev, crtc, intel_encoder) {
753 ret = intel_encoder;
754 num_encoders++;
755 }
756
757 if (num_encoders != 1)
758 WARN(1, "%d encoders on crtc for pipe %c\n", num_encoders,
759 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
760
761 BUG_ON(ret == NULL);
762 return ret;
763}
764
765struct intel_encoder *
766intel_ddi_get_crtc_new_encoder(struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state)
767{
768 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc_state->base.crtc);
769 struct intel_encoder *ret = NULL;
770 struct drm_atomic_state *state;
771 struct drm_connector *connector;
772 struct drm_connector_state *connector_state;
773 int num_encoders = 0;
774 int i;
775
776 state = crtc_state->base.state;
777
778 for_each_connector_in_state(state, connector, connector_state, i) {
779 if (connector_state->crtc != crtc_state->base.crtc)
780 continue;
781
782 ret = to_intel_encoder(connector_state->best_encoder);
783 num_encoders++;
784 }
785
786 WARN(num_encoders != 1, "%d encoders on crtc for pipe %c\n", num_encoders,
787 pipe_name(crtc->pipe));
788
789 BUG_ON(ret == NULL);
790 return ret;
791}
792
793#define LC_FREQ 2700
794#define LC_FREQ_2K U64_C(LC_FREQ * 2000)
795
796#define P_MIN 2
797#define P_MAX 64
798#define P_INC 2
799
800/* Constraints for PLL good behavior */
801#define REF_MIN 48
802#define REF_MAX 400
803#define VCO_MIN 2400
804#define VCO_MAX 4800
805
806#define abs_diff(a, b) ({ \
807 typeof(a) __a = (a); \
808 typeof(b) __b = (b); \
809 (void) (&__a == &__b); \
810 __a > __b ? (__a - __b) : (__b - __a); })
811
812struct hsw_wrpll_rnp {
813 unsigned p, n2, r2;
814};
815
816static unsigned hsw_wrpll_get_budget_for_freq(int clock)
817{
818 unsigned budget;
819
820 switch (clock) {
821 case 25175000:
822 case 25200000:
823 case 27000000:
824 case 27027000:
825 case 37762500:
826 case 37800000:
827 case 40500000:
828 case 40541000:
829 case 54000000:
830 case 54054000:
831 case 59341000:
832 case 59400000:
833 case 72000000:
834 case 74176000:
835 case 74250000:
836 case 81000000:
837 case 81081000:
838 case 89012000:
839 case 89100000:
840 case 108000000:
841 case 108108000:
842 case 111264000:
843 case 111375000:
844 case 148352000:
845 case 148500000:
846 case 162000000:
847 case 162162000:
848 case 222525000:
849 case 222750000:
850 case 296703000:
851 case 297000000:
852 budget = 0;
853 break;
854 case 233500000:
855 case 245250000:
856 case 247750000:
857 case 253250000:
858 case 298000000:
859 budget = 1500;
860 break;
861 case 169128000:
862 case 169500000:
863 case 179500000:
864 case 202000000:
865 budget = 2000;
866 break;
867 case 256250000:
868 case 262500000:
869 case 270000000:
870 case 272500000:
871 case 273750000:
872 case 280750000:
873 case 281250000:
874 case 286000000:
875 case 291750000:
876 budget = 4000;
877 break;
878 case 267250000:
879 case 268500000:
880 budget = 5000;
881 break;
882 default:
883 budget = 1000;
884 break;
885 }
886
887 return budget;
888}
889
890static void hsw_wrpll_update_rnp(uint64_t freq2k, unsigned budget,
891 unsigned r2, unsigned n2, unsigned p,
892 struct hsw_wrpll_rnp *best)
893{
894 uint64_t a, b, c, d, diff, diff_best;
895
896 /* No best (r,n,p) yet */
897 if (best->p == 0) {
898 best->p = p;
899 best->n2 = n2;
900 best->r2 = r2;
901 return;
902 }
903
904 /*
905 * Output clock is (LC_FREQ_2K / 2000) * N / (P * R), which compares to
906 * freq2k.
907 *
908 * delta = 1e6 *
909 * abs(freq2k - (LC_FREQ_2K * n2/(p * r2))) /
910 * freq2k;
911 *
912 * and we would like delta <= budget.
913 *
914 * If the discrepancy is above the PPM-based budget, always prefer to
915 * improve upon the previous solution. However, if you're within the
916 * budget, try to maximize Ref * VCO, that is N / (P * R^2).
917 */
918 a = freq2k * budget * p * r2;
919 b = freq2k * budget * best->p * best->r2;
920 diff = abs_diff(freq2k * p * r2, LC_FREQ_2K * n2);
921 diff_best = abs_diff(freq2k * best->p * best->r2,
922 LC_FREQ_2K * best->n2);
923 c = 1000000 * diff;
924 d = 1000000 * diff_best;
925
926 if (a < c && b < d) {
927 /* If both are above the budget, pick the closer */
928 if (best->p * best->r2 * diff < p * r2 * diff_best) {
929 best->p = p;
930 best->n2 = n2;
931 best->r2 = r2;
932 }
933 } else if (a >= c && b < d) {
934 /* If A is below the threshold but B is above it? Update. */
935 best->p = p;
936 best->n2 = n2;
937 best->r2 = r2;
938 } else if (a >= c && b >= d) {
939 /* Both are below the limit, so pick the higher n2/(r2*r2) */
940 if (n2 * best->r2 * best->r2 > best->n2 * r2 * r2) {
941 best->p = p;
942 best->n2 = n2;
943 best->r2 = r2;
944 }
945 }
946 /* Otherwise a < c && b >= d, do nothing */
947}
948
949static int hsw_ddi_calc_wrpll_link(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv, int reg)
950{
951 int refclk = LC_FREQ;
952 int n, p, r;
953 u32 wrpll;
954
955 wrpll = I915_READ(reg);
956 switch (wrpll & WRPLL_PLL_REF_MASK) {
957 case WRPLL_PLL_SSC:
958 case WRPLL_PLL_NON_SSC:
959 /*
960 * We could calculate spread here, but our checking
961 * code only cares about 5% accuracy, and spread is a max of
962 * 0.5% downspread.
963 */
964 refclk = 135;
965 break;
966 case WRPLL_PLL_LCPLL:
967 refclk = LC_FREQ;
968 break;
969 default:
970 WARN(1, "bad wrpll refclk\n");
971 return 0;
972 }
973
974 r = wrpll & WRPLL_DIVIDER_REF_MASK;
975 p = (wrpll & WRPLL_DIVIDER_POST_MASK) >> WRPLL_DIVIDER_POST_SHIFT;
976 n = (wrpll & WRPLL_DIVIDER_FB_MASK) >> WRPLL_DIVIDER_FB_SHIFT;
977
978 /* Convert to KHz, p & r have a fixed point portion */
979 return (refclk * n * 100) / (p * r);
980}
981
982static int skl_calc_wrpll_link(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
983 uint32_t dpll)
984{
985 uint32_t cfgcr1_reg, cfgcr2_reg;
986 uint32_t cfgcr1_val, cfgcr2_val;
987 uint32_t p0, p1, p2, dco_freq;
988
989 cfgcr1_reg = DPLL_CFGCR1(dpll);
990 cfgcr2_reg = DPLL_CFGCR2(dpll);
991
992 cfgcr1_val = I915_READ(cfgcr1_reg);
993 cfgcr2_val = I915_READ(cfgcr2_reg);
994
995 p0 = cfgcr2_val & DPLL_CFGCR2_PDIV_MASK;
996 p2 = cfgcr2_val & DPLL_CFGCR2_KDIV_MASK;
997
998 if (cfgcr2_val & DPLL_CFGCR2_QDIV_MODE(1))
999 p1 = (cfgcr2_val & DPLL_CFGCR2_QDIV_RATIO_MASK) >> 8;
1000 else
1001 p1 = 1;
1002
1003
1004 switch (p0) {
1005 case DPLL_CFGCR2_PDIV_1:
1006 p0 = 1;
1007 break;
1008 case DPLL_CFGCR2_PDIV_2:
1009 p0 = 2;
1010 break;
1011 case DPLL_CFGCR2_PDIV_3:
1012 p0 = 3;
1013 break;
1014 case DPLL_CFGCR2_PDIV_7:
1015 p0 = 7;
1016 break;
1017 }
1018
1019 switch (p2) {
1020 case DPLL_CFGCR2_KDIV_5:
1021 p2 = 5;
1022 break;
1023 case DPLL_CFGCR2_KDIV_2:
1024 p2 = 2;
1025 break;
1026 case DPLL_CFGCR2_KDIV_3:
1027 p2 = 3;
1028 break;
1029 case DPLL_CFGCR2_KDIV_1:
1030 p2 = 1;
1031 break;
1032 }
1033
1034 dco_freq = (cfgcr1_val & DPLL_CFGCR1_DCO_INTEGER_MASK) * 24 * 1000;
1035
1036 dco_freq += (((cfgcr1_val & DPLL_CFGCR1_DCO_FRACTION_MASK) >> 9) * 24 *
1037 1000) / 0x8000;
1038
1039 return dco_freq / (p0 * p1 * p2 * 5);
1040}
1041
1042static void ddi_dotclock_get(struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
1043{
1044 int dotclock;
1045
1046 if (pipe_config->has_pch_encoder)
1047 dotclock = intel_dotclock_calculate(pipe_config->port_clock,
1048 &pipe_config->fdi_m_n);
1049 else if (pipe_config->has_dp_encoder)
1050 dotclock = intel_dotclock_calculate(pipe_config->port_clock,
1051 &pipe_config->dp_m_n);
1052 else if (pipe_config->has_hdmi_sink && pipe_config->pipe_bpp == 36)
1053 dotclock = pipe_config->port_clock * 2 / 3;
1054 else
1055 dotclock = pipe_config->port_clock;
1056
1057 if (pipe_config->pixel_multiplier)
1058 dotclock /= pipe_config->pixel_multiplier;
1059
1060 pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_clock = dotclock;
1061}
1062
1063static void skl_ddi_clock_get(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
1064 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
1065{
1066 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->base.dev->dev_private;
1067 int link_clock = 0;
1068 uint32_t dpll_ctl1, dpll;
1069
1070 dpll = pipe_config->ddi_pll_sel;
1071
1072 dpll_ctl1 = I915_READ(DPLL_CTRL1);
1073
1074 if (dpll_ctl1 & DPLL_CTRL1_HDMI_MODE(dpll)) {
1075 link_clock = skl_calc_wrpll_link(dev_priv, dpll);
1076 } else {
1077 link_clock = dpll_ctl1 & DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_MASK(dpll);
1078 link_clock >>= DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_SHIFT(dpll);
1079
1080 switch (link_clock) {
1081 case DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_810:
1082 link_clock = 81000;
1083 break;
1084 case DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_1080:
1085 link_clock = 108000;
1086 break;
1087 case DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_1350:
1088 link_clock = 135000;
1089 break;
1090 case DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_1620:
1091 link_clock = 162000;
1092 break;
1093 case DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_2160:
1094 link_clock = 216000;
1095 break;
1096 case DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_2700:
1097 link_clock = 270000;
1098 break;
1099 default:
1100 WARN(1, "Unsupported link rate\n");
1101 break;
1102 }
1103 link_clock *= 2;
1104 }
1105
1106 pipe_config->port_clock = link_clock;
1107
1108 ddi_dotclock_get(pipe_config);
1109}
1110
1111static void hsw_ddi_clock_get(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
1112 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
1113{
1114 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->base.dev->dev_private;
1115 int link_clock = 0;
1116 u32 val, pll;
1117
1118 val = pipe_config->ddi_pll_sel;
1119 switch (val & PORT_CLK_SEL_MASK) {
1120 case PORT_CLK_SEL_LCPLL_810:
1121 link_clock = 81000;
1122 break;
1123 case PORT_CLK_SEL_LCPLL_1350:
1124 link_clock = 135000;
1125 break;
1126 case PORT_CLK_SEL_LCPLL_2700:
1127 link_clock = 270000;
1128 break;
1129 case PORT_CLK_SEL_WRPLL1:
1130 link_clock = hsw_ddi_calc_wrpll_link(dev_priv, WRPLL_CTL1);
1131 break;
1132 case PORT_CLK_SEL_WRPLL2:
1133 link_clock = hsw_ddi_calc_wrpll_link(dev_priv, WRPLL_CTL2);
1134 break;
1135 case PORT_CLK_SEL_SPLL:
1136 pll = I915_READ(SPLL_CTL) & SPLL_PLL_FREQ_MASK;
1137 if (pll == SPLL_PLL_FREQ_810MHz)
1138 link_clock = 81000;
1139 else if (pll == SPLL_PLL_FREQ_1350MHz)
1140 link_clock = 135000;
1141 else if (pll == SPLL_PLL_FREQ_2700MHz)
1142 link_clock = 270000;
1143 else {
1144 WARN(1, "bad spll freq\n");
1145 return;
1146 }
1147 break;
1148 default:
1149 WARN(1, "bad port clock sel\n");
1150 return;
1151 }
1152
1153 pipe_config->port_clock = link_clock * 2;
1154
1155 ddi_dotclock_get(pipe_config);
1156}
1157
1158static int bxt_calc_pll_link(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
1159 enum intel_dpll_id dpll)
1160{
1161 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll;
1162 struct intel_dpll_hw_state *state;
1163 intel_clock_t clock;
1164
1165 /* For DDI ports we always use a shared PLL. */
1166 if (WARN_ON(dpll == DPLL_ID_PRIVATE))
1167 return 0;
1168
1169 pll = &dev_priv->shared_dplls[dpll];
1170 state = &pll->config.hw_state;
1171
1172 clock.m1 = 2;
1173 clock.m2 = (state->pll0 & PORT_PLL_M2_MASK) << 22;
1174 if (state->pll3 & PORT_PLL_M2_FRAC_ENABLE)
1175 clock.m2 |= state->pll2 & PORT_PLL_M2_FRAC_MASK;
1176 clock.n = (state->pll1 & PORT_PLL_N_MASK) >> PORT_PLL_N_SHIFT;
1177 clock.p1 = (state->ebb0 & PORT_PLL_P1_MASK) >> PORT_PLL_P1_SHIFT;
1178 clock.p2 = (state->ebb0 & PORT_PLL_P2_MASK) >> PORT_PLL_P2_SHIFT;
1179
1180 return chv_calc_dpll_params(100000, &clock);
1181}
1182
1183static void bxt_ddi_clock_get(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
1184 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
1185{
1186 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->base.dev->dev_private;
1187 enum port port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(encoder);
1188 uint32_t dpll = port;
1189
1190 pipe_config->port_clock = bxt_calc_pll_link(dev_priv, dpll);
1191
1192 ddi_dotclock_get(pipe_config);
1193}
1194
1195void intel_ddi_clock_get(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
1196 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
1197{
1198 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1199
1200 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen <= 8)
1201 hsw_ddi_clock_get(encoder, pipe_config);
1202 else if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev))
1203 skl_ddi_clock_get(encoder, pipe_config);
1204 else if (IS_BROXTON(dev))
1205 bxt_ddi_clock_get(encoder, pipe_config);
1206}
1207
1208static void
1209hsw_ddi_calculate_wrpll(int clock /* in Hz */,
1210 unsigned *r2_out, unsigned *n2_out, unsigned *p_out)
1211{
1212 uint64_t freq2k;
1213 unsigned p, n2, r2;
1214 struct hsw_wrpll_rnp best = { 0, 0, 0 };
1215 unsigned budget;
1216
1217 freq2k = clock / 100;
1218
1219 budget = hsw_wrpll_get_budget_for_freq(clock);
1220
1221 /* Special case handling for 540 pixel clock: bypass WR PLL entirely
1222 * and directly pass the LC PLL to it. */
1223 if (freq2k == 5400000) {
1224 *n2_out = 2;
1225 *p_out = 1;
1226 *r2_out = 2;
1227 return;
1228 }
1229
1230 /*
1231 * Ref = LC_FREQ / R, where Ref is the actual reference input seen by
1232 * the WR PLL.
1233 *
1234 * We want R so that REF_MIN <= Ref <= REF_MAX.
1235 * Injecting R2 = 2 * R gives:
1236 * REF_MAX * r2 > LC_FREQ * 2 and
1237 * REF_MIN * r2 < LC_FREQ * 2
1238 *
1239 * Which means the desired boundaries for r2 are:
1240 * LC_FREQ * 2 / REF_MAX < r2 < LC_FREQ * 2 / REF_MIN
1241 *
1242 */
1243 for (r2 = LC_FREQ * 2 / REF_MAX + 1;
1244 r2 <= LC_FREQ * 2 / REF_MIN;
1245 r2++) {
1246
1247 /*
1248 * VCO = N * Ref, that is: VCO = N * LC_FREQ / R
1249 *
1250 * Once again we want VCO_MIN <= VCO <= VCO_MAX.
1251 * Injecting R2 = 2 * R and N2 = 2 * N, we get:
1252 * VCO_MAX * r2 > n2 * LC_FREQ and
1253 * VCO_MIN * r2 < n2 * LC_FREQ)
1254 *
1255 * Which means the desired boundaries for n2 are:
1256 * VCO_MIN * r2 / LC_FREQ < n2 < VCO_MAX * r2 / LC_FREQ
1257 */
1258 for (n2 = VCO_MIN * r2 / LC_FREQ + 1;
1259 n2 <= VCO_MAX * r2 / LC_FREQ;
1260 n2++) {
1261
1262 for (p = P_MIN; p <= P_MAX; p += P_INC)
1263 hsw_wrpll_update_rnp(freq2k, budget,
1264 r2, n2, p, &best);
1265 }
1266 }
1267
1268 *n2_out = best.n2;
1269 *p_out = best.p;
1270 *r2_out = best.r2;
1271}
1272
1273static bool
1274hsw_ddi_pll_select(struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc,
1275 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state,
1276 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
1277{
1278 int clock = crtc_state->port_clock;
1279
1280 if (intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI) {
1281 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll;
1282 uint32_t val;
1283 unsigned p, n2, r2;
1284
1285 hsw_ddi_calculate_wrpll(clock * 1000, &r2, &n2, &p);
1286
1287 val = WRPLL_PLL_ENABLE | WRPLL_PLL_LCPLL |
1288 WRPLL_DIVIDER_REFERENCE(r2) | WRPLL_DIVIDER_FEEDBACK(n2) |
1289 WRPLL_DIVIDER_POST(p);
1290
1291 memset(&crtc_state->dpll_hw_state, 0,
1292 sizeof(crtc_state->dpll_hw_state));
1293
1294 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.wrpll = val;
1295
1296 pll = intel_get_shared_dpll(intel_crtc, crtc_state);
1297 if (pll == NULL) {
1298 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("failed to find PLL for pipe %c\n",
1299 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
1300 return false;
1301 }
1302
1303 crtc_state->ddi_pll_sel = PORT_CLK_SEL_WRPLL(pll->id);
1304 } else if (crtc_state->ddi_pll_sel == PORT_CLK_SEL_SPLL) {
1305 struct drm_atomic_state *state = crtc_state->base.state;
1306 struct intel_shared_dpll_config *spll =
1307 &intel_atomic_get_shared_dpll_state(state)[DPLL_ID_SPLL];
1308
1309 if (spll->crtc_mask &&
1310 WARN_ON(spll->hw_state.spll != crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.spll))
1311 return false;
1312
1313 crtc_state->shared_dpll = DPLL_ID_SPLL;
1314 spll->hw_state.spll = crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.spll;
1315 spll->crtc_mask |= 1 << intel_crtc->pipe;
1316 }
1317
1318 return true;
1319}
1320
1321struct skl_wrpll_context {
1322 uint64_t min_deviation; /* current minimal deviation */
1323 uint64_t central_freq; /* chosen central freq */
1324 uint64_t dco_freq; /* chosen dco freq */
1325 unsigned int p; /* chosen divider */
1326};
1327
1328static void skl_wrpll_context_init(struct skl_wrpll_context *ctx)
1329{
1330 memset(ctx, 0, sizeof(*ctx));
1331
1332 ctx->min_deviation = U64_MAX;
1333}
1334
1335/* DCO freq must be within +1%/-6% of the DCO central freq */
1336#define SKL_DCO_MAX_PDEVIATION 100
1337#define SKL_DCO_MAX_NDEVIATION 600
1338
1339static void skl_wrpll_try_divider(struct skl_wrpll_context *ctx,
1340 uint64_t central_freq,
1341 uint64_t dco_freq,
1342 unsigned int divider)
1343{
1344 uint64_t deviation;
1345
1346 deviation = div64_u64(10000 * abs_diff(dco_freq, central_freq),
1347 central_freq);
1348
1349 /* positive deviation */
1350 if (dco_freq >= central_freq) {
1351 if (deviation < SKL_DCO_MAX_PDEVIATION &&
1352 deviation < ctx->min_deviation) {
1353 ctx->min_deviation = deviation;
1354 ctx->central_freq = central_freq;
1355 ctx->dco_freq = dco_freq;
1356 ctx->p = divider;
1357 }
1358 /* negative deviation */
1359 } else if (deviation < SKL_DCO_MAX_NDEVIATION &&
1360 deviation < ctx->min_deviation) {
1361 ctx->min_deviation = deviation;
1362 ctx->central_freq = central_freq;
1363 ctx->dco_freq = dco_freq;
1364 ctx->p = divider;
1365 }
1366}
1367
1368static void skl_wrpll_get_multipliers(unsigned int p,
1369 unsigned int *p0 /* out */,
1370 unsigned int *p1 /* out */,
1371 unsigned int *p2 /* out */)
1372{
1373 /* even dividers */
1374 if (p % 2 == 0) {
1375 unsigned int half = p / 2;
1376
1377 if (half == 1 || half == 2 || half == 3 || half == 5) {
1378 *p0 = 2;
1379 *p1 = 1;
1380 *p2 = half;
1381 } else if (half % 2 == 0) {
1382 *p0 = 2;
1383 *p1 = half / 2;
1384 *p2 = 2;
1385 } else if (half % 3 == 0) {
1386 *p0 = 3;
1387 *p1 = half / 3;
1388 *p2 = 2;
1389 } else if (half % 7 == 0) {
1390 *p0 = 7;
1391 *p1 = half / 7;
1392 *p2 = 2;
1393 }
1394 } else if (p == 3 || p == 9) { /* 3, 5, 7, 9, 15, 21, 35 */
1395 *p0 = 3;
1396 *p1 = 1;
1397 *p2 = p / 3;
1398 } else if (p == 5 || p == 7) {
1399 *p0 = p;
1400 *p1 = 1;
1401 *p2 = 1;
1402 } else if (p == 15) {
1403 *p0 = 3;
1404 *p1 = 1;
1405 *p2 = 5;
1406 } else if (p == 21) {
1407 *p0 = 7;
1408 *p1 = 1;
1409 *p2 = 3;
1410 } else if (p == 35) {
1411 *p0 = 7;
1412 *p1 = 1;
1413 *p2 = 5;
1414 }
1415}
1416
1417struct skl_wrpll_params {
1418 uint32_t dco_fraction;
1419 uint32_t dco_integer;
1420 uint32_t qdiv_ratio;
1421 uint32_t qdiv_mode;
1422 uint32_t kdiv;
1423 uint32_t pdiv;
1424 uint32_t central_freq;
1425};
1426
1427static void skl_wrpll_params_populate(struct skl_wrpll_params *params,
1428 uint64_t afe_clock,
1429 uint64_t central_freq,
1430 uint32_t p0, uint32_t p1, uint32_t p2)
1431{
1432 uint64_t dco_freq;
1433
1434 switch (central_freq) {
1435 case 9600000000ULL:
1436 params->central_freq = 0;
1437 break;
1438 case 9000000000ULL:
1439 params->central_freq = 1;
1440 break;
1441 case 8400000000ULL:
1442 params->central_freq = 3;
1443 }
1444
1445 switch (p0) {
1446 case 1:
1447 params->pdiv = 0;
1448 break;
1449 case 2:
1450 params->pdiv = 1;
1451 break;
1452 case 3:
1453 params->pdiv = 2;
1454 break;
1455 case 7:
1456 params->pdiv = 4;
1457 break;
1458 default:
1459 WARN(1, "Incorrect PDiv\n");
1460 }
1461
1462 switch (p2) {
1463 case 5:
1464 params->kdiv = 0;
1465 break;
1466 case 2:
1467 params->kdiv = 1;
1468 break;
1469 case 3:
1470 params->kdiv = 2;
1471 break;
1472 case 1:
1473 params->kdiv = 3;
1474 break;
1475 default:
1476 WARN(1, "Incorrect KDiv\n");
1477 }
1478
1479 params->qdiv_ratio = p1;
1480 params->qdiv_mode = (params->qdiv_ratio == 1) ? 0 : 1;
1481
1482 dco_freq = p0 * p1 * p2 * afe_clock;
1483
1484 /*
1485 * Intermediate values are in Hz.
1486 * Divide by MHz to match bsepc
1487 */
1488 params->dco_integer = div_u64(dco_freq, 24 * MHz(1));
1489 params->dco_fraction =
1490 div_u64((div_u64(dco_freq, 24) -
1491 params->dco_integer * MHz(1)) * 0x8000, MHz(1));
1492}
1493
1494static bool
1495skl_ddi_calculate_wrpll(int clock /* in Hz */,
1496 struct skl_wrpll_params *wrpll_params)
1497{
1498 uint64_t afe_clock = clock * 5; /* AFE Clock is 5x Pixel clock */
1499 uint64_t dco_central_freq[3] = {8400000000ULL,
1500 9000000000ULL,
1501 9600000000ULL};
1502 static const int even_dividers[] = { 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20,
1503 24, 28, 30, 32, 36, 40, 42, 44,
1504 48, 52, 54, 56, 60, 64, 66, 68,
1505 70, 72, 76, 78, 80, 84, 88, 90,
1506 92, 96, 98 };
1507 static const int odd_dividers[] = { 3, 5, 7, 9, 15, 21, 35 };
1508 static const struct {
1509 const int *list;
1510 int n_dividers;
1511 } dividers[] = {
1512 { even_dividers, ARRAY_SIZE(even_dividers) },
1513 { odd_dividers, ARRAY_SIZE(odd_dividers) },
1514 };
1515 struct skl_wrpll_context ctx;
1516 unsigned int dco, d, i;
1517 unsigned int p0, p1, p2;
1518
1519 skl_wrpll_context_init(&ctx);
1520
1521 for (d = 0; d < ARRAY_SIZE(dividers); d++) {
1522 for (dco = 0; dco < ARRAY_SIZE(dco_central_freq); dco++) {
1523 for (i = 0; i < dividers[d].n_dividers; i++) {
1524 unsigned int p = dividers[d].list[i];
1525 uint64_t dco_freq = p * afe_clock;
1526
1527 skl_wrpll_try_divider(&ctx,
1528 dco_central_freq[dco],
1529 dco_freq,
1530 p);
1531 /*
1532 * Skip the remaining dividers if we're sure to
1533 * have found the definitive divider, we can't
1534 * improve a 0 deviation.
1535 */
1536 if (ctx.min_deviation == 0)
1537 goto skip_remaining_dividers;
1538 }
1539 }
1540
1541skip_remaining_dividers:
1542 /*
1543 * If a solution is found with an even divider, prefer
1544 * this one.
1545 */
1546 if (d == 0 && ctx.p)
1547 break;
1548 }
1549
1550 if (!ctx.p) {
1551 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("No valid divider found for %dHz\n", clock);
1552 return false;
1553 }
1554
1555 /*
1556 * gcc incorrectly analyses that these can be used without being
1557 * initialized. To be fair, it's hard to guess.
1558 */
1559 p0 = p1 = p2 = 0;
1560 skl_wrpll_get_multipliers(ctx.p, &p0, &p1, &p2);
1561 skl_wrpll_params_populate(wrpll_params, afe_clock, ctx.central_freq,
1562 p0, p1, p2);
1563
1564 return true;
1565}
1566
1567static bool
1568skl_ddi_pll_select(struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc,
1569 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state,
1570 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
1571{
1572 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll;
1573 uint32_t ctrl1, cfgcr1, cfgcr2;
1574 int clock = crtc_state->port_clock;
1575
1576 /*
1577 * See comment in intel_dpll_hw_state to understand why we always use 0
1578 * as the DPLL id in this function.
1579 */
1580
1581 ctrl1 = DPLL_CTRL1_OVERRIDE(0);
1582
1583 if (intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI) {
1584 struct skl_wrpll_params wrpll_params = { 0, };
1585
1586 ctrl1 |= DPLL_CTRL1_HDMI_MODE(0);
1587
1588 if (!skl_ddi_calculate_wrpll(clock * 1000, &wrpll_params))
1589 return false;
1590
1591 cfgcr1 = DPLL_CFGCR1_FREQ_ENABLE |
1592 DPLL_CFGCR1_DCO_FRACTION(wrpll_params.dco_fraction) |
1593 wrpll_params.dco_integer;
1594
1595 cfgcr2 = DPLL_CFGCR2_QDIV_RATIO(wrpll_params.qdiv_ratio) |
1596 DPLL_CFGCR2_QDIV_MODE(wrpll_params.qdiv_mode) |
1597 DPLL_CFGCR2_KDIV(wrpll_params.kdiv) |
1598 DPLL_CFGCR2_PDIV(wrpll_params.pdiv) |
1599 wrpll_params.central_freq;
1600 } else if (intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT ||
1601 intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DP_MST) {
1602 switch (crtc_state->port_clock / 2) {
1603 case 81000:
1604 ctrl1 |= DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE(DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_810, 0);
1605 break;
1606 case 135000:
1607 ctrl1 |= DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE(DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_1350, 0);
1608 break;
1609 case 270000:
1610 ctrl1 |= DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE(DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_2700, 0);
1611 break;
1612 }
1613
1614 cfgcr1 = cfgcr2 = 0;
1615 } else /* eDP */
1616 return true;
1617
1618 memset(&crtc_state->dpll_hw_state, 0,
1619 sizeof(crtc_state->dpll_hw_state));
1620
1621 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.ctrl1 = ctrl1;
1622 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.cfgcr1 = cfgcr1;
1623 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.cfgcr2 = cfgcr2;
1624
1625 pll = intel_get_shared_dpll(intel_crtc, crtc_state);
1626 if (pll == NULL) {
1627 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("failed to find PLL for pipe %c\n",
1628 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
1629 return false;
1630 }
1631
1632 /* shared DPLL id 0 is DPLL 1 */
1633 crtc_state->ddi_pll_sel = pll->id + 1;
1634
1635 return true;
1636}
1637
1638/* bxt clock parameters */
1639struct bxt_clk_div {
1640 int clock;
1641 uint32_t p1;
1642 uint32_t p2;
1643 uint32_t m2_int;
1644 uint32_t m2_frac;
1645 bool m2_frac_en;
1646 uint32_t n;
1647};
1648
1649/* pre-calculated values for DP linkrates */
1650static const struct bxt_clk_div bxt_dp_clk_val[] = {
1651 {162000, 4, 2, 32, 1677722, 1, 1},
1652 {270000, 4, 1, 27, 0, 0, 1},
1653 {540000, 2, 1, 27, 0, 0, 1},
1654 {216000, 3, 2, 32, 1677722, 1, 1},
1655 {243000, 4, 1, 24, 1258291, 1, 1},
1656 {324000, 4, 1, 32, 1677722, 1, 1},
1657 {432000, 3, 1, 32, 1677722, 1, 1}
1658};
1659
1660static bool
1661bxt_ddi_pll_select(struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc,
1662 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state,
1663 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
1664{
1665 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll;
1666 struct bxt_clk_div clk_div = {0};
1667 int vco = 0;
1668 uint32_t prop_coef, int_coef, gain_ctl, targ_cnt;
1669 uint32_t lanestagger;
1670 int clock = crtc_state->port_clock;
1671
1672 if (intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI) {
1673 intel_clock_t best_clock;
1674
1675 /* Calculate HDMI div */
1676 /*
1677 * FIXME: tie the following calculation into
1678 * i9xx_crtc_compute_clock
1679 */
1680 if (!bxt_find_best_dpll(crtc_state, clock, &best_clock)) {
1681 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("no PLL dividers found for clock %d pipe %c\n",
1682 clock, pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
1683 return false;
1684 }
1685
1686 clk_div.p1 = best_clock.p1;
1687 clk_div.p2 = best_clock.p2;
1688 WARN_ON(best_clock.m1 != 2);
1689 clk_div.n = best_clock.n;
1690 clk_div.m2_int = best_clock.m2 >> 22;
1691 clk_div.m2_frac = best_clock.m2 & ((1 << 22) - 1);
1692 clk_div.m2_frac_en = clk_div.m2_frac != 0;
1693
1694 vco = best_clock.vco;
1695 } else if (intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT ||
1696 intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
1697 int i;
1698
1699 clk_div = bxt_dp_clk_val[0];
1700 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(bxt_dp_clk_val); ++i) {
1701 if (bxt_dp_clk_val[i].clock == clock) {
1702 clk_div = bxt_dp_clk_val[i];
1703 break;
1704 }
1705 }
1706 vco = clock * 10 / 2 * clk_div.p1 * clk_div.p2;
1707 }
1708
1709 if (vco >= 6200000 && vco <= 6700000) {
1710 prop_coef = 4;
1711 int_coef = 9;
1712 gain_ctl = 3;
1713 targ_cnt = 8;
1714 } else if ((vco > 5400000 && vco < 6200000) ||
1715 (vco >= 4800000 && vco < 5400000)) {
1716 prop_coef = 5;
1717 int_coef = 11;
1718 gain_ctl = 3;
1719 targ_cnt = 9;
1720 } else if (vco == 5400000) {
1721 prop_coef = 3;
1722 int_coef = 8;
1723 gain_ctl = 1;
1724 targ_cnt = 9;
1725 } else {
1726 DRM_ERROR("Invalid VCO\n");
1727 return false;
1728 }
1729
1730 memset(&crtc_state->dpll_hw_state, 0,
1731 sizeof(crtc_state->dpll_hw_state));
1732
1733 if (clock > 270000)
1734 lanestagger = 0x18;
1735 else if (clock > 135000)
1736 lanestagger = 0x0d;
1737 else if (clock > 67000)
1738 lanestagger = 0x07;
1739 else if (clock > 33000)
1740 lanestagger = 0x04;
1741 else
1742 lanestagger = 0x02;
1743
1744 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.ebb0 =
1745 PORT_PLL_P1(clk_div.p1) | PORT_PLL_P2(clk_div.p2);
1746 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll0 = clk_div.m2_int;
1747 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll1 = PORT_PLL_N(clk_div.n);
1748 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll2 = clk_div.m2_frac;
1749
1750 if (clk_div.m2_frac_en)
1751 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll3 =
1752 PORT_PLL_M2_FRAC_ENABLE;
1753
1754 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll6 =
1755 prop_coef | PORT_PLL_INT_COEFF(int_coef);
1756 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll6 |=
1757 PORT_PLL_GAIN_CTL(gain_ctl);
1758
1759 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll8 = targ_cnt;
1760
1761 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll9 = 5 << PORT_PLL_LOCK_THRESHOLD_SHIFT;
1762
1763 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pll10 =
1764 PORT_PLL_DCO_AMP(PORT_PLL_DCO_AMP_DEFAULT)
1765 | PORT_PLL_DCO_AMP_OVR_EN_H;
1766
1767 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.ebb4 = PORT_PLL_10BIT_CLK_ENABLE;
1768
1769 crtc_state->dpll_hw_state.pcsdw12 =
1770 LANESTAGGER_STRAP_OVRD | lanestagger;
1771
1772 pll = intel_get_shared_dpll(intel_crtc, crtc_state);
1773 if (pll == NULL) {
1774 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("failed to find PLL for pipe %c\n",
1775 pipe_name(intel_crtc->pipe));
1776 return false;
1777 }
1778
1779 /* shared DPLL id 0 is DPLL A */
1780 crtc_state->ddi_pll_sel = pll->id;
1781
1782 return true;
1783}
1784
1785/*
1786 * Tries to find a *shared* PLL for the CRTC and store it in
1787 * intel_crtc->ddi_pll_sel.
1788 *
1789 * For private DPLLs, compute_config() should do the selection for us. This
1790 * function should be folded into compute_config() eventually.
1791 */
1792bool intel_ddi_pll_select(struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc,
1793 struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state)
1794{
1795 struct drm_device *dev = intel_crtc->base.dev;
1796 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder =
1797 intel_ddi_get_crtc_new_encoder(crtc_state);
1798
1799 if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev))
1800 return skl_ddi_pll_select(intel_crtc, crtc_state,
1801 intel_encoder);
1802 else if (IS_BROXTON(dev))
1803 return bxt_ddi_pll_select(intel_crtc, crtc_state,
1804 intel_encoder);
1805 else
1806 return hsw_ddi_pll_select(intel_crtc, crtc_state,
1807 intel_encoder);
1808}
1809
1810void intel_ddi_set_pipe_settings(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
1811{
1812 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = crtc->dev->dev_private;
1813 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
1814 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder = intel_ddi_get_crtc_encoder(crtc);
1815 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder = intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder;
1816 int type = intel_encoder->type;
1817 uint32_t temp;
1818
1819 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT || type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP || type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DP_MST) {
1820 temp = TRANS_MSA_SYNC_CLK;
1821 switch (intel_crtc->config->pipe_bpp) {
1822 case 18:
1823 temp |= TRANS_MSA_6_BPC;
1824 break;
1825 case 24:
1826 temp |= TRANS_MSA_8_BPC;
1827 break;
1828 case 30:
1829 temp |= TRANS_MSA_10_BPC;
1830 break;
1831 case 36:
1832 temp |= TRANS_MSA_12_BPC;
1833 break;
1834 default:
1835 BUG();
1836 }
1837 I915_WRITE(TRANS_MSA_MISC(cpu_transcoder), temp);
1838 }
1839}
1840
1841void intel_ddi_set_vc_payload_alloc(struct drm_crtc *crtc, bool state)
1842{
1843 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
1844 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
1845 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1846 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder = intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder;
1847 uint32_t temp;
1848 temp = I915_READ(TRANS_DDI_FUNC_CTL(cpu_transcoder));
1849 if (state == true)
1850 temp |= TRANS_DDI_DP_VC_PAYLOAD_ALLOC;
1851 else
1852 temp &= ~TRANS_DDI_DP_VC_PAYLOAD_ALLOC;
1853 I915_WRITE(TRANS_DDI_FUNC_CTL(cpu_transcoder), temp);
1854}
1855
1856void intel_ddi_enable_transcoder_func(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
1857{
1858 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
1859 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder = intel_ddi_get_crtc_encoder(crtc);
1860 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_encoder->base;
1861 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
1862 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1863 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
1864 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder = intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder;
1865 enum port port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder);
1866 int type = intel_encoder->type;
1867 uint32_t temp;
1868
1869 /* Enable TRANS_DDI_FUNC_CTL for the pipe to work in HDMI mode */
1870 temp = TRANS_DDI_FUNC_ENABLE;
1871 temp |= TRANS_DDI_SELECT_PORT(port);
1872
1873 switch (intel_crtc->config->pipe_bpp) {
1874 case 18:
1875 temp |= TRANS_DDI_BPC_6;
1876 break;
1877 case 24:
1878 temp |= TRANS_DDI_BPC_8;
1879 break;
1880 case 30:
1881 temp |= TRANS_DDI_BPC_10;
1882 break;
1883 case 36:
1884 temp |= TRANS_DDI_BPC_12;
1885 break;
1886 default:
1887 BUG();
1888 }
1889
1890 if (intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode.flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_PVSYNC)
1891 temp |= TRANS_DDI_PVSYNC;
1892 if (intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode.flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_PHSYNC)
1893 temp |= TRANS_DDI_PHSYNC;
1894
1895 if (cpu_transcoder == TRANSCODER_EDP) {
1896 switch (pipe) {
1897 case PIPE_A:
1898 /* On Haswell, can only use the always-on power well for
1899 * eDP when not using the panel fitter, and when not
1900 * using motion blur mitigation (which we don't
1901 * support). */
1902 if (IS_HASWELL(dev) &&
1903 (intel_crtc->config->pch_pfit.enabled ||
1904 intel_crtc->config->pch_pfit.force_thru))
1905 temp |= TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_A_ONOFF;
1906 else
1907 temp |= TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_A_ON;
1908 break;
1909 case PIPE_B:
1910 temp |= TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_B_ONOFF;
1911 break;
1912 case PIPE_C:
1913 temp |= TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_C_ONOFF;
1914 break;
1915 default:
1916 BUG();
1917 break;
1918 }
1919 }
1920
1921 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI) {
1922 if (intel_crtc->config->has_hdmi_sink)
1923 temp |= TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_HDMI;
1924 else
1925 temp |= TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DVI;
1926
1927 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_ANALOG) {
1928 temp |= TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_FDI;
1929 temp |= (intel_crtc->config->fdi_lanes - 1) << 1;
1930
1931 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT ||
1932 type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
1933 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = enc_to_intel_dp(encoder);
1934
1935 if (intel_dp->is_mst) {
1936 temp |= TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DP_MST;
1937 } else
1938 temp |= TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DP_SST;
1939
1940 temp |= DDI_PORT_WIDTH(intel_crtc->config->lane_count);
1941 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DP_MST) {
1942 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = &enc_to_mst(encoder)->primary->dp;
1943
1944 if (intel_dp->is_mst) {
1945 temp |= TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DP_MST;
1946 } else
1947 temp |= TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DP_SST;
1948
1949 temp |= DDI_PORT_WIDTH(intel_crtc->config->lane_count);
1950 } else {
1951 WARN(1, "Invalid encoder type %d for pipe %c\n",
1952 intel_encoder->type, pipe_name(pipe));
1953 }
1954
1955 I915_WRITE(TRANS_DDI_FUNC_CTL(cpu_transcoder), temp);
1956}
1957
1958void intel_ddi_disable_transcoder_func(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
1959 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder)
1960{
1961 uint32_t reg = TRANS_DDI_FUNC_CTL(cpu_transcoder);
1962 uint32_t val = I915_READ(reg);
1963
1964 val &= ~(TRANS_DDI_FUNC_ENABLE | TRANS_DDI_PORT_MASK | TRANS_DDI_DP_VC_PAYLOAD_ALLOC);
1965 val |= TRANS_DDI_PORT_NONE;
1966 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
1967}
1968
1969bool intel_ddi_connector_get_hw_state(struct intel_connector *intel_connector)
1970{
1971 struct drm_device *dev = intel_connector->base.dev;
1972 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1973 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder = intel_connector->encoder;
1974 int type = intel_connector->base.connector_type;
1975 enum port port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder);
1976 enum i915_pipe pipe = 0;
1977 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder;
1978 enum intel_display_power_domain power_domain;
1979 uint32_t tmp;
1980
1981 power_domain = intel_display_port_power_domain(intel_encoder);
1982 if (!intel_display_power_is_enabled(dev_priv, power_domain))
1983 return false;
1984
1985 if (!intel_encoder->get_hw_state(intel_encoder, &pipe))
1986 return false;
1987
1988 if (port == PORT_A)
1989 cpu_transcoder = TRANSCODER_EDP;
1990 else
1991 cpu_transcoder = (enum transcoder) pipe;
1992
1993 tmp = I915_READ(TRANS_DDI_FUNC_CTL(cpu_transcoder));
1994
1995 switch (tmp & TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_MASK) {
1996 case TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_HDMI:
1997 case TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DVI:
1998 return (type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_HDMIA);
1999
2000 case TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DP_SST:
2001 if (type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_eDP)
2002 return true;
2003 return (type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DisplayPort);
2004 case TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DP_MST:
2005 /* if the transcoder is in MST state then
2006 * connector isn't connected */
2007 return false;
2008
2009 case TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_FDI:
2010 return (type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_VGA);
2011
2012 default:
2013 return false;
2014 }
2015}
2016
2017bool intel_ddi_get_hw_state(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
2018 enum i915_pipe *pipe)
2019{
2020 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
2021 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2022 enum port port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(encoder);
2023 enum intel_display_power_domain power_domain;
2024 u32 tmp;
2025 int i;
2026
2027 power_domain = intel_display_port_power_domain(encoder);
2028 if (!intel_display_power_is_enabled(dev_priv, power_domain))
2029 return false;
2030
2031 tmp = I915_READ(DDI_BUF_CTL(port));
2032
2033 if (!(tmp & DDI_BUF_CTL_ENABLE))
2034 return false;
2035
2036 if (port == PORT_A) {
2037 tmp = I915_READ(TRANS_DDI_FUNC_CTL(TRANSCODER_EDP));
2038
2039 switch (tmp & TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_MASK) {
2040 case TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_A_ON:
2041 case TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_A_ONOFF:
2042 *pipe = PIPE_A;
2043 break;
2044 case TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_B_ONOFF:
2045 *pipe = PIPE_B;
2046 break;
2047 case TRANS_DDI_EDP_INPUT_C_ONOFF:
2048 *pipe = PIPE_C;
2049 break;
2050 }
2051
2052 return true;
2053 } else {
2054 for (i = TRANSCODER_A; i <= TRANSCODER_C; i++) {
2055 tmp = I915_READ(TRANS_DDI_FUNC_CTL(i));
2056
2057 if ((tmp & TRANS_DDI_PORT_MASK)
2058 == TRANS_DDI_SELECT_PORT(port)) {
2059 if ((tmp & TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_MASK) == TRANS_DDI_MODE_SELECT_DP_MST)
2060 return false;
2061
2062 *pipe = i;
2063 return true;
2064 }
2065 }
2066 }
2067
2068 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("No pipe for ddi port %c found\n", port_name(port));
2069
2070 return false;
2071}
2072
2073void intel_ddi_enable_pipe_clock(struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc)
2074{
2075 struct drm_crtc *crtc = &intel_crtc->base;
2076 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
2077 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2078 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder = intel_ddi_get_crtc_encoder(crtc);
2079 enum port port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder);
2080 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder = intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder;
2081
2082 if (cpu_transcoder != TRANSCODER_EDP)
2083 I915_WRITE(TRANS_CLK_SEL(cpu_transcoder),
2084 TRANS_CLK_SEL_PORT(port));
2085}
2086
2087void intel_ddi_disable_pipe_clock(struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc)
2088{
2089 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = intel_crtc->base.dev->dev_private;
2090 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder = intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder;
2091
2092 if (cpu_transcoder != TRANSCODER_EDP)
2093 I915_WRITE(TRANS_CLK_SEL(cpu_transcoder),
2094 TRANS_CLK_SEL_DISABLED);
2095}
2096
2097static void skl_ddi_set_iboost(struct drm_device *dev, u32 level,
2098 enum port port, int type)
2099{
2100 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2101 const struct ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations;
2102 uint8_t iboost;
2103 uint8_t dp_iboost, hdmi_iboost;
2104 int n_entries;
2105 u32 reg;
2106
2107 /* VBT may override standard boost values */
2108 dp_iboost = dev_priv->vbt.ddi_port_info[port].dp_boost_level;
2109 hdmi_iboost = dev_priv->vbt.ddi_port_info[port].hdmi_boost_level;
2110
2111 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT) {
2112 if (dp_iboost) {
2113 iboost = dp_iboost;
2114 } else {
2115 ddi_translations = skl_get_buf_trans_dp(dev, &n_entries);
2116 iboost = ddi_translations[port].i_boost;
2117 }
2118 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
2119 if (dp_iboost) {
2120 iboost = dp_iboost;
2121 } else {
2122 ddi_translations = skl_get_buf_trans_edp(dev, &n_entries);
2123 iboost = ddi_translations[port].i_boost;
2124 }
2125 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI) {
2126 if (hdmi_iboost) {
2127 iboost = hdmi_iboost;
2128 } else {
2129 ddi_translations = skl_get_buf_trans_hdmi(dev, &n_entries);
2130 iboost = ddi_translations[port].i_boost;
2131 }
2132 } else {
2133 return;
2134 }
2135
2136 /* Make sure that the requested I_boost is valid */
2137 if (iboost && iboost != 0x1 && iboost != 0x3 && iboost != 0x7) {
2138 DRM_ERROR("Invalid I_boost value %u\n", iboost);
2139 return;
2140 }
2141
2142 reg = I915_READ(DISPIO_CR_TX_BMU_CR0);
2143 reg &= ~BALANCE_LEG_MASK(port);
2144 reg &= ~(1 << (BALANCE_LEG_DISABLE_SHIFT + port));
2145
2146 if (iboost)
2147 reg |= iboost << BALANCE_LEG_SHIFT(port);
2148 else
2149 reg |= 1 << (BALANCE_LEG_DISABLE_SHIFT + port);
2150
2151 I915_WRITE(DISPIO_CR_TX_BMU_CR0, reg);
2152}
2153
2154static void bxt_ddi_vswing_sequence(struct drm_device *dev, u32 level,
2155 enum port port, int type)
2156{
2157 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2158 const struct bxt_ddi_buf_trans *ddi_translations;
2159 u32 n_entries, i;
2160 uint32_t val;
2161
2162 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP && dev_priv->edp_low_vswing) {
2163 n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bxt_ddi_translations_edp);
2164 ddi_translations = bxt_ddi_translations_edp;
2165 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT
2166 || type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
2167 n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bxt_ddi_translations_dp);
2168 ddi_translations = bxt_ddi_translations_dp;
2169 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI) {
2170 n_entries = ARRAY_SIZE(bxt_ddi_translations_hdmi);
2171 ddi_translations = bxt_ddi_translations_hdmi;
2172 } else {
2173 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Vswing programming not done for encoder %d\n",
2174 type);
2175 return;
2176 }
2177
2178 /* Check if default value has to be used */
2179 if (level >= n_entries ||
2180 (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI && level == HDMI_LEVEL_SHIFT_UNKNOWN)) {
2181 for (i = 0; i < n_entries; i++) {
2182 if (ddi_translations[i].default_index) {
2183 level = i;
2184 break;
2185 }
2186 }
2187 }
2188
2189 /*
2190 * While we write to the group register to program all lanes at once we
2191 * can read only lane registers and we pick lanes 0/1 for that.
2192 */
2193 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PCS_DW10_LN01(port));
2194 val &= ~(TX2_SWING_CALC_INIT | TX1_SWING_CALC_INIT);
2195 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PCS_DW10_GRP(port), val);
2196
2197 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_TX_DW2_LN0(port));
2198 val &= ~(MARGIN_000 | UNIQ_TRANS_SCALE);
2199 val |= ddi_translations[level].margin << MARGIN_000_SHIFT |
2200 ddi_translations[level].scale << UNIQ_TRANS_SCALE_SHIFT;
2201 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_TX_DW2_GRP(port), val);
2202
2203 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_TX_DW3_LN0(port));
2204 val &= ~SCALE_DCOMP_METHOD;
2205 if (ddi_translations[level].enable)
2206 val |= SCALE_DCOMP_METHOD;
2207
2208 if ((val & UNIQUE_TRANGE_EN_METHOD) && !(val & SCALE_DCOMP_METHOD))
2209 DRM_ERROR("Disabled scaling while ouniqetrangenmethod was set");
2210
2211 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_TX_DW3_GRP(port), val);
2212
2213 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_TX_DW4_LN0(port));
2214 val &= ~DE_EMPHASIS;
2215 val |= ddi_translations[level].deemphasis << DEEMPH_SHIFT;
2216 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_TX_DW4_GRP(port), val);
2217
2218 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PCS_DW10_LN01(port));
2219 val |= TX2_SWING_CALC_INIT | TX1_SWING_CALC_INIT;
2220 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PCS_DW10_GRP(port), val);
2221}
2222
2223static uint32_t translate_signal_level(int signal_levels)
2224{
2225 uint32_t level;
2226
2227 switch (signal_levels) {
2228 default:
2229 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Unsupported voltage swing/pre-emphasis level: 0x%x\n",
2230 signal_levels);
2231 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_0 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_0:
2232 level = 0;
2233 break;
2234 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_0 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_1:
2235 level = 1;
2236 break;
2237 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_0 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_2:
2238 level = 2;
2239 break;
2240 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_0 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_3:
2241 level = 3;
2242 break;
2243
2244 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_1 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_0:
2245 level = 4;
2246 break;
2247 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_1 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_1:
2248 level = 5;
2249 break;
2250 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_1 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_2:
2251 level = 6;
2252 break;
2253
2254 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_2 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_0:
2255 level = 7;
2256 break;
2257 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_2 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_1:
2258 level = 8;
2259 break;
2260
2261 case DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_LEVEL_3 | DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPH_LEVEL_0:
2262 level = 9;
2263 break;
2264 }
2265
2266 return level;
2267}
2268
2269uint32_t ddi_signal_levels(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
2270{
2271 struct intel_digital_port *dport = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
2272 struct drm_device *dev = dport->base.base.dev;
2273 struct intel_encoder *encoder = &dport->base;
2274 uint8_t train_set = intel_dp->train_set[0];
2275 int signal_levels = train_set & (DP_TRAIN_VOLTAGE_SWING_MASK |
2276 DP_TRAIN_PRE_EMPHASIS_MASK);
2277 enum port port = dport->port;
2278 uint32_t level;
2279
2280 level = translate_signal_level(signal_levels);
2281
2282 if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev))
2283 skl_ddi_set_iboost(dev, level, port, encoder->type);
2284 else if (IS_BROXTON(dev))
2285 bxt_ddi_vswing_sequence(dev, level, port, encoder->type);
2286
2287 return DDI_BUF_TRANS_SELECT(level);
2288}
2289
2290static void intel_ddi_pre_enable(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
2291{
2292 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_encoder->base;
2293 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
2294 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2295 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
2296 enum port port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder);
2297 int type = intel_encoder->type;
2298 int hdmi_level;
2299
2300 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
2301 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = enc_to_intel_dp(encoder);
2302 intel_edp_panel_on(intel_dp);
2303 }
2304
2305 if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev)) {
2306 uint32_t dpll = crtc->config->ddi_pll_sel;
2307 uint32_t val;
2308
2309 /*
2310 * DPLL0 is used for eDP and is the only "private" DPLL (as
2311 * opposed to shared) on SKL
2312 */
2313 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
2314 WARN_ON(dpll != SKL_DPLL0);
2315
2316 val = I915_READ(DPLL_CTRL1);
2317
2318 val &= ~(DPLL_CTRL1_HDMI_MODE(dpll) |
2319 DPLL_CTRL1_SSC(dpll) |
2320 DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_MASK(dpll));
2321 val |= crtc->config->dpll_hw_state.ctrl1 << (dpll * 6);
2322
2323 I915_WRITE(DPLL_CTRL1, val);
2324 POSTING_READ(DPLL_CTRL1);
2325 }
2326
2327 /* DDI -> PLL mapping */
2328 val = I915_READ(DPLL_CTRL2);
2329
2330 val &= ~(DPLL_CTRL2_DDI_CLK_OFF(port) |
2331 DPLL_CTRL2_DDI_CLK_SEL_MASK(port));
2332 val |= (DPLL_CTRL2_DDI_CLK_SEL(dpll, port) |
2333 DPLL_CTRL2_DDI_SEL_OVERRIDE(port));
2334
2335 I915_WRITE(DPLL_CTRL2, val);
2336
2337 } else if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 9) {
2338 WARN_ON(crtc->config->ddi_pll_sel == PORT_CLK_SEL_NONE);
2339 I915_WRITE(PORT_CLK_SEL(port), crtc->config->ddi_pll_sel);
2340 }
2341
2342 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT || type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
2343 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = enc_to_intel_dp(encoder);
2344
2345 intel_dp_set_link_params(intel_dp, crtc->config);
2346
2347 intel_ddi_init_dp_buf_reg(intel_encoder);
2348
2349 intel_dp_sink_dpms(intel_dp, DRM_MODE_DPMS_ON);
2350 intel_dp_start_link_train(intel_dp);
2351 if (port != PORT_A || INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9)
2352 intel_dp_stop_link_train(intel_dp);
2353 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI) {
2354 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(encoder);
2355
2356 if (IS_BROXTON(dev)) {
2357 hdmi_level = dev_priv->vbt.
2358 ddi_port_info[port].hdmi_level_shift;
2359 bxt_ddi_vswing_sequence(dev, hdmi_level, port,
2360 INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI);
2361 }
2362 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes(encoder,
2363 crtc->config->has_hdmi_sink,
2364 &crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode);
2365 }
2366}
2367
2368static void intel_ddi_post_disable(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
2369{
2370 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_encoder->base;
2371 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
2372 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2373 enum port port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder);
2374 int type = intel_encoder->type;
2375 uint32_t val;
2376 bool wait = false;
2377
2378 val = I915_READ(DDI_BUF_CTL(port));
2379 if (val & DDI_BUF_CTL_ENABLE) {
2380 val &= ~DDI_BUF_CTL_ENABLE;
2381 I915_WRITE(DDI_BUF_CTL(port), val);
2382 wait = true;
2383 }
2384
2385 val = I915_READ(DP_TP_CTL(port));
2386 val &= ~(DP_TP_CTL_ENABLE | DP_TP_CTL_LINK_TRAIN_MASK);
2387 val |= DP_TP_CTL_LINK_TRAIN_PAT1;
2388 I915_WRITE(DP_TP_CTL(port), val);
2389
2390 if (wait)
2391 intel_wait_ddi_buf_idle(dev_priv, port);
2392
2393 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT || type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
2394 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = enc_to_intel_dp(encoder);
2395 intel_dp_sink_dpms(intel_dp, DRM_MODE_DPMS_OFF);
2396 intel_edp_panel_vdd_on(intel_dp);
2397 intel_edp_panel_off(intel_dp);
2398 }
2399
2400 if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev))
2401 I915_WRITE(DPLL_CTRL2, (I915_READ(DPLL_CTRL2) |
2402 DPLL_CTRL2_DDI_CLK_OFF(port)));
2403 else if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 9)
2404 I915_WRITE(PORT_CLK_SEL(port), PORT_CLK_SEL_NONE);
2405}
2406
2407static void intel_enable_ddi(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
2408{
2409 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_encoder->base;
2410 struct drm_crtc *crtc = encoder->crtc;
2411 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
2412 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
2413 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2414 enum port port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder);
2415 int type = intel_encoder->type;
2416
2417 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI) {
2418 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port =
2419 enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
2420
2421 /* In HDMI/DVI mode, the port width, and swing/emphasis values
2422 * are ignored so nothing special needs to be done besides
2423 * enabling the port.
2424 */
2425 I915_WRITE(DDI_BUF_CTL(port),
2426 intel_dig_port->saved_port_bits |
2427 DDI_BUF_CTL_ENABLE);
2428 } else if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
2429 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = enc_to_intel_dp(encoder);
2430
2431 if (port == PORT_A && INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 9)
2432 intel_dp_stop_link_train(intel_dp);
2433
2434 intel_edp_backlight_on(intel_dp);
2435 intel_psr_enable(intel_dp);
2436 intel_edp_drrs_enable(intel_dp);
2437 }
2438
2439 if (intel_crtc->config->has_audio) {
2440 intel_display_power_get(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_AUDIO);
2441 intel_audio_codec_enable(intel_encoder);
2442 }
2443}
2444
2445static void intel_disable_ddi(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
2446{
2447 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_encoder->base;
2448 struct drm_crtc *crtc = encoder->crtc;
2449 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
2450 int type = intel_encoder->type;
2451 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
2452 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2453
2454 if (intel_crtc->config->has_audio) {
2455 intel_audio_codec_disable(intel_encoder);
2456 intel_display_power_put(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_AUDIO);
2457 }
2458
2459 if (type == INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP) {
2460 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = enc_to_intel_dp(encoder);
2461
2462 intel_edp_drrs_disable(intel_dp);
2463 intel_psr_disable(intel_dp);
2464 intel_edp_backlight_off(intel_dp);
2465 }
2466}
2467
2468static void hsw_ddi_wrpll_enable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2469 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll)
2470{
2471 I915_WRITE(WRPLL_CTL(pll->id), pll->config.hw_state.wrpll);
2472 POSTING_READ(WRPLL_CTL(pll->id));
2473 udelay(20);
2474}
2475
2476static void hsw_ddi_spll_enable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2477 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll)
2478{
2479 I915_WRITE(SPLL_CTL, pll->config.hw_state.spll);
2480 POSTING_READ(SPLL_CTL);
2481 udelay(20);
2482}
2483
2484static void hsw_ddi_wrpll_disable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2485 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll)
2486{
2487 uint32_t val;
2488
2489 val = I915_READ(WRPLL_CTL(pll->id));
2490 I915_WRITE(WRPLL_CTL(pll->id), val & ~WRPLL_PLL_ENABLE);
2491 POSTING_READ(WRPLL_CTL(pll->id));
2492}
2493
2494static void hsw_ddi_spll_disable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2495 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll)
2496{
2497 uint32_t val;
2498
2499 val = I915_READ(SPLL_CTL);
2500 I915_WRITE(SPLL_CTL, val & ~SPLL_PLL_ENABLE);
2501 POSTING_READ(SPLL_CTL);
2502}
2503
2504static bool hsw_ddi_wrpll_get_hw_state(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2505 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll,
2506 struct intel_dpll_hw_state *hw_state)
2507{
2508 uint32_t val;
2509
2510 if (!intel_display_power_is_enabled(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_PLLS))
2511 return false;
2512
2513 val = I915_READ(WRPLL_CTL(pll->id));
2514 hw_state->wrpll = val;
2515
2516 return val & WRPLL_PLL_ENABLE;
2517}
2518
2519static bool hsw_ddi_spll_get_hw_state(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2520 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll,
2521 struct intel_dpll_hw_state *hw_state)
2522{
2523 uint32_t val;
2524
2525 if (!intel_display_power_is_enabled(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_PLLS))
2526 return false;
2527
2528 val = I915_READ(SPLL_CTL);
2529 hw_state->spll = val;
2530
2531 return val & SPLL_PLL_ENABLE;
2532}
2533
2534
2535static const char * const hsw_ddi_pll_names[] = {
2536 "WRPLL 1",
2537 "WRPLL 2",
2538 "SPLL"
2539};
2540
2541static void hsw_shared_dplls_init(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
2542{
2543 int i;
2544
2545 dev_priv->num_shared_dpll = 3;
2546
2547 for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
2548 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].id = i;
2549 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].name = hsw_ddi_pll_names[i];
2550 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].disable = hsw_ddi_wrpll_disable;
2551 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].enable = hsw_ddi_wrpll_enable;
2552 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].get_hw_state =
2553 hsw_ddi_wrpll_get_hw_state;
2554 }
2555
2556 /* SPLL is special, but needs to be initialized anyway.. */
2557 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].id = i;
2558 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].name = hsw_ddi_pll_names[i];
2559 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].disable = hsw_ddi_spll_disable;
2560 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].enable = hsw_ddi_spll_enable;
2561 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].get_hw_state = hsw_ddi_spll_get_hw_state;
2562
2563}
2564
2565static const char * const skl_ddi_pll_names[] = {
2566 "DPLL 1",
2567 "DPLL 2",
2568 "DPLL 3",
2569};
2570
2571struct skl_dpll_regs {
2572 u32 ctl, cfgcr1, cfgcr2;
2573};
2574
2575/* this array is indexed by the *shared* pll id */
2576static const struct skl_dpll_regs skl_dpll_regs[3] = {
2577 {
2578 /* DPLL 1 */
2579 .ctl = LCPLL2_CTL,
2580 .cfgcr1 = DPLL_CFGCR1(SKL_DPLL1),
2581 .cfgcr2 = DPLL_CFGCR2(SKL_DPLL1),
2582 },
2583 {
2584 /* DPLL 2 */
2585 .ctl = WRPLL_CTL1,
2586 .cfgcr1 = DPLL_CFGCR1(SKL_DPLL2),
2587 .cfgcr2 = DPLL_CFGCR2(SKL_DPLL2),
2588 },
2589 {
2590 /* DPLL 3 */
2591 .ctl = WRPLL_CTL2,
2592 .cfgcr1 = DPLL_CFGCR1(SKL_DPLL3),
2593 .cfgcr2 = DPLL_CFGCR2(SKL_DPLL3),
2594 },
2595};
2596
2597static void skl_ddi_pll_enable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2598 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll)
2599{
2600 uint32_t val;
2601 unsigned int dpll;
2602 const struct skl_dpll_regs *regs = skl_dpll_regs;
2603
2604 /* DPLL0 is not part of the shared DPLLs, so pll->id is 0 for DPLL1 */
2605 dpll = pll->id + 1;
2606
2607 val = I915_READ(DPLL_CTRL1);
2608
2609 val &= ~(DPLL_CTRL1_HDMI_MODE(dpll) | DPLL_CTRL1_SSC(dpll) |
2610 DPLL_CTRL1_LINK_RATE_MASK(dpll));
2611 val |= pll->config.hw_state.ctrl1 << (dpll * 6);
2612
2613 I915_WRITE(DPLL_CTRL1, val);
2614 POSTING_READ(DPLL_CTRL1);
2615
2616 I915_WRITE(regs[pll->id].cfgcr1, pll->config.hw_state.cfgcr1);
2617 I915_WRITE(regs[pll->id].cfgcr2, pll->config.hw_state.cfgcr2);
2618 POSTING_READ(regs[pll->id].cfgcr1);
2619 POSTING_READ(regs[pll->id].cfgcr2);
2620
2621 /* the enable bit is always bit 31 */
2622 I915_WRITE(regs[pll->id].ctl,
2623 I915_READ(regs[pll->id].ctl) | LCPLL_PLL_ENABLE);
2624
2625 if (wait_for(I915_READ(DPLL_STATUS) & DPLL_LOCK(dpll), 5))
2626 DRM_ERROR("DPLL %d not locked\n", dpll);
2627}
2628
2629static void skl_ddi_pll_disable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2630 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll)
2631{
2632 const struct skl_dpll_regs *regs = skl_dpll_regs;
2633
2634 /* the enable bit is always bit 31 */
2635 I915_WRITE(regs[pll->id].ctl,
2636 I915_READ(regs[pll->id].ctl) & ~LCPLL_PLL_ENABLE);
2637 POSTING_READ(regs[pll->id].ctl);
2638}
2639
2640static bool skl_ddi_pll_get_hw_state(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2641 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll,
2642 struct intel_dpll_hw_state *hw_state)
2643{
2644 uint32_t val;
2645 unsigned int dpll;
2646 const struct skl_dpll_regs *regs = skl_dpll_regs;
2647
2648 if (!intel_display_power_is_enabled(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_PLLS))
2649 return false;
2650
2651 /* DPLL0 is not part of the shared DPLLs, so pll->id is 0 for DPLL1 */
2652 dpll = pll->id + 1;
2653
2654 val = I915_READ(regs[pll->id].ctl);
2655 if (!(val & LCPLL_PLL_ENABLE))
2656 return false;
2657
2658 val = I915_READ(DPLL_CTRL1);
2659 hw_state->ctrl1 = (val >> (dpll * 6)) & 0x3f;
2660
2661 /* avoid reading back stale values if HDMI mode is not enabled */
2662 if (val & DPLL_CTRL1_HDMI_MODE(dpll)) {
2663 hw_state->cfgcr1 = I915_READ(regs[pll->id].cfgcr1);
2664 hw_state->cfgcr2 = I915_READ(regs[pll->id].cfgcr2);
2665 }
2666
2667 return true;
2668}
2669
2670static void skl_shared_dplls_init(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
2671{
2672 int i;
2673
2674 dev_priv->num_shared_dpll = 3;
2675
2676 for (i = 0; i < dev_priv->num_shared_dpll; i++) {
2677 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].id = i;
2678 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].name = skl_ddi_pll_names[i];
2679 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].disable = skl_ddi_pll_disable;
2680 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].enable = skl_ddi_pll_enable;
2681 dev_priv->shared_dplls[i].get_hw_state =
2682 skl_ddi_pll_get_hw_state;
2683 }
2684}
2685
2686static void broxton_phy_init(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2687 enum dpio_phy phy)
2688{
2689 enum port port;
2690 uint32_t val;
2691
2692 val = I915_READ(BXT_P_CR_GT_DISP_PWRON);
2693 val |= GT_DISPLAY_POWER_ON(phy);
2694 I915_WRITE(BXT_P_CR_GT_DISP_PWRON, val);
2695
2696 /* Considering 10ms timeout until BSpec is updated */
2697 if (wait_for(I915_READ(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW0(phy)) & PHY_POWER_GOOD, 10))
2698 DRM_ERROR("timeout during PHY%d power on\n", phy);
2699
2700 for (port = (phy == DPIO_PHY0 ? PORT_B : PORT_A);
2701 port <= (phy == DPIO_PHY0 ? PORT_C : PORT_A); port++) {
2702 int lane;
2703
2704 for (lane = 0; lane < 4; lane++) {
2705 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_TX_DW14_LN(port, lane));
2706 /*
2707 * Note that on CHV this flag is called UPAR, but has
2708 * the same function.
2709 */
2710 val &= ~LATENCY_OPTIM;
2711 if (lane != 1)
2712 val |= LATENCY_OPTIM;
2713
2714 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_TX_DW14_LN(port, lane), val);
2715 }
2716 }
2717
2718 /* Program PLL Rcomp code offset */
2719 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW9(phy));
2720 val &= ~IREF0RC_OFFSET_MASK;
2721 val |= 0xE4 << IREF0RC_OFFSET_SHIFT;
2722 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW9(phy), val);
2723
2724 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW10(phy));
2725 val &= ~IREF1RC_OFFSET_MASK;
2726 val |= 0xE4 << IREF1RC_OFFSET_SHIFT;
2727 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW10(phy), val);
2728
2729 /* Program power gating */
2730 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW28(phy));
2731 val |= OCL1_POWER_DOWN_EN | DW28_OLDO_DYN_PWR_DOWN_EN |
2732 SUS_CLK_CONFIG;
2733 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW28(phy), val);
2734
2735 if (phy == DPIO_PHY0) {
2736 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_CL2CM_DW6_BC);
2737 val |= DW6_OLDO_DYN_PWR_DOWN_EN;
2738 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_CL2CM_DW6_BC, val);
2739 }
2740
2741 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW30(phy));
2742 val &= ~OCL2_LDOFUSE_PWR_DIS;
2743 /*
2744 * On PHY1 disable power on the second channel, since no port is
2745 * connected there. On PHY0 both channels have a port, so leave it
2746 * enabled.
2747 * TODO: port C is only connected on BXT-P, so on BXT0/1 we should
2748 * power down the second channel on PHY0 as well.
2749 */
2750 if (phy == DPIO_PHY1)
2751 val |= OCL2_LDOFUSE_PWR_DIS;
2752 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_CL1CM_DW30(phy), val);
2753
2754 if (phy == DPIO_PHY0) {
2755 uint32_t grc_code;
2756 /*
2757 * PHY0 isn't connected to an RCOMP resistor so copy over
2758 * the corresponding calibrated value from PHY1, and disable
2759 * the automatic calibration on PHY0.
2760 */
2761 if (wait_for(I915_READ(BXT_PORT_REF_DW3(DPIO_PHY1)) & GRC_DONE,
2762 10))
2763 DRM_ERROR("timeout waiting for PHY1 GRC\n");
2764
2765 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_REF_DW6(DPIO_PHY1));
2766 val = (val & GRC_CODE_MASK) >> GRC_CODE_SHIFT;
2767 grc_code = val << GRC_CODE_FAST_SHIFT |
2768 val << GRC_CODE_SLOW_SHIFT |
2769 val;
2770 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_REF_DW6(DPIO_PHY0), grc_code);
2771
2772 val = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_REF_DW8(DPIO_PHY0));
2773 val |= GRC_DIS | GRC_RDY_OVRD;
2774 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_REF_DW8(DPIO_PHY0), val);
2775 }
2776
2777 val = I915_READ(BXT_PHY_CTL_FAMILY(phy));
2778 val |= COMMON_RESET_DIS;
2779 I915_WRITE(BXT_PHY_CTL_FAMILY(phy), val);
2780}
2781
2782void broxton_ddi_phy_init(struct drm_device *dev)
2783{
2784 /* Enable PHY1 first since it provides Rcomp for PHY0 */
2785 broxton_phy_init(dev->dev_private, DPIO_PHY1);
2786 broxton_phy_init(dev->dev_private, DPIO_PHY0);
2787}
2788
2789static void broxton_phy_uninit(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2790 enum dpio_phy phy)
2791{
2792 uint32_t val;
2793
2794 val = I915_READ(BXT_PHY_CTL_FAMILY(phy));
2795 val &= ~COMMON_RESET_DIS;
2796 I915_WRITE(BXT_PHY_CTL_FAMILY(phy), val);
2797}
2798
2799void broxton_ddi_phy_uninit(struct drm_device *dev)
2800{
2801 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2802
2803 broxton_phy_uninit(dev_priv, DPIO_PHY1);
2804 broxton_phy_uninit(dev_priv, DPIO_PHY0);
2805
2806 /* FIXME: do this in broxton_phy_uninit per phy */
2807 I915_WRITE(BXT_P_CR_GT_DISP_PWRON, 0);
2808}
2809
2810static const char * const bxt_ddi_pll_names[] = {
2811 "PORT PLL A",
2812 "PORT PLL B",
2813 "PORT PLL C",
2814};
2815
2816static void bxt_ddi_pll_enable(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2817 struct intel_shared_dpll *pll)
2818{
2819 uint32_t temp;
2820 enum port port = (enum port)pll->id; /* 1:1 port->PLL mapping */
2821
2822 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL_ENABLE(port));
2823 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_REF_SEL;
2824 /* Non-SSC reference */
2825 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL_ENABLE(port), temp);
2826
2827 /* Disable 10 bit clock */
2828 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL_EBB_4(port));
2829 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_10BIT_CLK_ENABLE;
2830 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL_EBB_4(port), temp);
2831
2832 /* Write P1 & P2 */
2833 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL_EBB_0(port));
2834 temp &= ~(PORT_PLL_P1_MASK | PORT_PLL_P2_MASK);
2835 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.ebb0;
2836 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL_EBB_0(port), temp);
2837
2838 /* Write M2 integer */
2839 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 0));
2840 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_M2_MASK;
2841 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.pll0;
2842 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 0), temp);
2843
2844 /* Write N */
2845 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 1));
2846 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_N_MASK;
2847 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.pll1;
2848 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 1), temp);
2849
2850 /* Write M2 fraction */
2851 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 2));
2852 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_M2_FRAC_MASK;
2853 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.pll2;
2854 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 2), temp);
2855
2856 /* Write M2 fraction enable */
2857 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 3));
2858 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_M2_FRAC_ENABLE;
2859 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.pll3;
2860 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 3), temp);
2861
2862 /* Write coeff */
2863 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 6));
2864 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_PROP_COEFF_MASK;
2865 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_INT_COEFF_MASK;
2866 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_GAIN_CTL_MASK;
2867 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.pll6;
2868 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 6), temp);
2869
2870 /* Write calibration val */
2871 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 8));
2872 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_TARGET_CNT_MASK;
2873 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.pll8;
2874 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 8), temp);
2875
2876 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 9));
2877 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_LOCK_THRESHOLD_MASK;
2878 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.pll9;
2879 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 9), temp);
2880
2881 temp = I915_READ(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 10));
2882 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_DCO_AMP_OVR_EN_H;
2883 temp &= ~PORT_PLL_DCO_AMP_MASK;
2884 temp |= pll->config.hw_state.pll10;
2885 I915_WRITE(BXT_PORT_PLL(port, 10), temp);
2886
2887 /* Recalibrate with new settings */
